Posts.Content: luv2trav wrote: HI I have been reading posts for the last week and I am grateful for all the information. I found a lump in my right breast 8 days ago. Went to gyn on 1/6 and sent for a dx mammo and sonno.  Radiologist told me it was highly suspect (BIRADS 4) and wanted me to see a BS as soon as possible.  I went to the doc yesterday and he feels that it is most likely a malignancy. Due to the weather I have to wait to tomorrow to get the biopsy done, he also said I would have to do a MRI. I am trying to find out information on stuff related to work-like whether or not I will be able to work during all this, FMLA and such.  Appreciate any help any one can give me Today is a gift...thats why they call it the present Dx 1/2011, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/10 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: some newbie questions luv2trav shells43

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2011 09:25PM luv2trav wrote: timerdog I ,too, thought of many choice words for your bf as I read your post (reminds me of my EX-husband) but I will give him the benefit of the doubt and say he is having stress about this,  That being said, you need to concentrate on you and your daughter and not waste energy on him.  Do what you need to do to keep you going.  You can do this.  I am confused as to why they told you not to work...I am a school nurse and i am being encouraged to go to work.  Cant get much germier than a school nurse office.  Perhaps you should talk about this with your onc.  Money causes stress and we dont need any more of that! Plus it is good to keep busy. Hugs
Posts.Title: relationship will not survive timerdog alamik

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 10:14PM luv2trav wrote: thanks for all the responses...I feel better today ....doc seemed to think that it was probably dehydration
Posts.Title: felt better after surgery, now feel lousy luv2trav memory

Posts.Content: luv2trav wrote: HI all I had a lumpectomy with SNB on Friday feb 11th.  The PS also did a lift on the good breast to make it look the same.  Spent the last few days hanging out in the recliner watching tv, reading etc.  I was very sore but that is starting to get better.  the problem?  Today I felt like i crashed and burned...couldnt keep my eyes open at all, very nauseous and vomited a couple of times. Any thoughts as to why i feel worse today? Could I be anemic? Any ideas on how to feel better? i am glad I found this site...you guys are awesome. Today is a gift...thats why they call it the present Dx 1/2011, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/10 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: felt better after surgery, now feel lousy luv2trav memory

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2011 01:56PM luv2trav wrote: Thanks for the responses...saw the breast surgeon today...going to have lumpectomy on the 11th...plastics will be there too to "fill" the space left behind by the tumor....not happy I have to wait until the 11th but dont really have a choice.  I happened to stop by the onc office that the BS recommended...stopped to get a card...ended up having a very helpful conversation with the onc.  I like how he said that this is just a detour and it is his job to keep me on the right path to enjoying my life.  Also said that working would be possible.   Now all i have to do is wait for 2 weeks ugh!!!
Posts.Title: Newbie...question about working luv2trav patty61

Posts.Content: luv2trav wrote: Hi all I am a 45 yr old mother of 2 (one in heaven, one here on earth) who was just dx with IDC.  I found a good sized lump on 1/4/2011...have had core biopsy and MRI and I am scheduled to sit down with my BS on Tuesday to discuss a game plan.  I am thinking that it will be surgery.  My path report came back ER pos, Pr pos and Her2 3+ positive.  My biggest question right now is work..I am a school nurse that works with sick kids all day.  I am also the main source of income for my household.  Will I be able to work during treatment???  Any guidance would be appreciated. Thanks! Today is a gift...thats why they call it the present Dx 1/2011, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/10 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Newbie...question about working luv2trav patty61

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2011 09:21AM luv2trav wrote: Thanks dragonfly I will check out the link.. I am a state emplyee and we dont get SDI either...last time I tried to buy my own, I got rejected because of my back...oh well.  I am thinking about doing a 4 day work week...like get chemo on Thursday afternoon, take Friday off and hopefully go to work on Monday.  I am also glad to hear you went back after 4 days...hoping I can do the same. I am sure we will talk soon
Posts.Title: Newbie...question about working luv2trav patty61

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2012 12:22PM luv2trav wrote: Havanna, Ok first step is Breath....I know there is a jumble of information in your head right now   Take it one step at a time, one moment at a time if you need to.  Whatever info you need, someone on here has been there and will be able to help you.  This is doable.  (((((hugs))))))
